properties.otherAdvice: The Cowra Carnival of Cups will be held on Sunday 12 November at the Cowra showground. There will be speed reduction, no parking zones and stop slow traffic on the Mid Western Highway (Grenfell Road)

NBL & WNBL Double Header at Qudos Bank Arena. Sydney Flames v Melbourne Boomers in the WNBL from 1:30pm and Sydney Kings v Brisbane Bullets tip-off from 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unles sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Supercross Championships Round 2 at McDonald Jones Stadium. Activations open 1pm and gates open at 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as attendees travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Music events at Fleet Steps in the Royal Botanic Garden Sydney.

  • Friday 17 November – 6pm to 10:30pm: Hot Dub on the Harbour
  • Saturday 18 November – 2pm to 10pm: Harbourlife
  • Sunday 19 November – 2pm to 10pm: Heaps Gay presents Wet Dreams

Traffic will be heavier than usual in the Sydney CBD on approaches to The Domain as attendees travel to the events. Traffic will be particularly heavy on Friday 17 November as attendees travel during the already busy Friday evening peak.

Sections of Mrs Macquaries Rd will be closed from 12:30pm Friday 17 November until 11:59pm Sunday 19 November to safely facilitate the events. A section of Art Gallery Rd will also be closed each night to allow attendees to safely leave the area.

Motorists travelling in the area should allow extra time and watch out for pedestrians.

arrangementElements.html:
MRS MACQUARIES ROAD – NORTHERN LOOP

  • The Northern Loop will be closed at the turning circle from 12:30pm Friday 17 November until 11:59pm Sunday 19 November.

ART GALLERY ROAD & MRS MACQUARIES ROAD – SOUTHERN LOOP

Art Gallery Road and the Southern Loop of Mrs Macquaries Road will be closed for pedestrain safetly leaving each event:

  • Friday 17 November from 9:30pm to 11:30pm
  • Saturday 18 November from 8:30pm to 11:00pm
  • Sunday 19 November from 8:30pm to 11:00pm
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.otherAdvice: The Sparke Helmore Newcastle City Triathlon will be held on Sunday 12 November from 6am to 5pm. Exercise caution, as there will be increased pedestrian activity in the area, as people make their way to and from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header: Central Coast Mariners v Brisbane Roar at Industree Group Stadium. Women's kick off from 2:15pm and men's kick off at 5pm. FInish around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 12.45pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

webLinks.linkText: 2023 IWWF World Water Ski Racing Championships

properties.otherAdvice: The 2023 IWWF World Water Ski Racing Championships will be held from Thursday 9 November to Sunday 19 November. The public boat ramp off Dane Drive will be closed during the event. Please exercise caution, as there will be increased pedestrian activity in the area.
properties.displayName: 2023 IWWF World Water Ski Racing Championships

properties.otherAdvice: The Multi-Cultural Street Event will be held on Saturday 11 November from 2pm to 9pm in Mayfield. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event.

A-League Women: Central Coast Mariners v Wellington Phoenix at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 6pm, full time around 7:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr may close before the match between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

A sold out crowd is expected to attend Carl Barron at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts at 8pm and finishes around 9:45pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as other events take place at neighbouring venues. Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd as crowds travel to and from the show.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
The Pet Show at Sydney Showground on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 November. Event runs from 10am to 4pm daily.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct, particularly on Saturday as other events take place at neighbouring venues in the precinct. Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Motorists should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Robbie Williams live at Allianz Stadium. Concert starts from 8pm and finishes around 10:20pm.

With more than 35,000 fans significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching Moore Park during the already busy Thursday night peak.

Motorists should expect delays and allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Fans are urged to catch public transport.

Road & Cycleway closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4:15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • The Moore Park Rd cycleway will be closed between Regent St and Oatley Rd outside the stadium from 4.30pm to midnight. Cyclists will be detoured via Gordon St, Renny St and Oatley Rd both directions. 
  • For the safe crowd bump out further closures will be in place on the Moore Park Rd/Fitzroy St cycleway from Poate Rd to Bourke St from 10pm to midnight. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm until midnight on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Special event clearways will be in place at the following locations to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations:

  • Clarence Street, Sydney CBD. Both western and eastern sides between Barrack Street and Margaret Street
  • York Street, Sydney CBD. Western side only between Margaret Street and Barrack Street

Clarence St will be affected northbound, York St southbound.

properties.publicTransport: Extra trains, bus, ferry and light rail services will run on Saturday. Motorists are encouraged to leave the car at home, but if people have to drive they should consider the park & ride option at McDonald Jones Stadium. For public transport information and bus service changes, visit transportnsw.info and newcastletransport.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Newcastle Williamtown Air Show will be held on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 November. On Saturday Air Force aircraft will take to the skies above the Newcastle coastline to conduct flying displays and flypasts with session 1 from 10am to 12:30pm and session 2 from 1:30pm to 4pm. On Sunday the Air Show will be held at Williamtown RAAF base. Viewing locations in Newcastle include Nobbys Beach and Foreshore Park or Stockton Parklands at Pitt Street Reserve and Griffith Park East.

Motorists should expect heavy traffic approaching Newcastle East and Stockton on Saturday as crowds travel to and from viewing locations. Changed traffic conditions including road closures will be in place.

Motorists are advised to follow the direction of traffic controllers and signage, and allow extra travel time.

Road closures:

  • On Saturday, all roads east of Watt St in Newcastle East will be closed. Local roads will also be closed in Stockton.
  • Wharf Rd will close at Argyle St for accessible parking between Argyle St and Watt St roundabout. An Accessible Parking Permit is required to gain access.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.publicTransport:
Raymond Terrace: Free parking on grass adjacent to the Council Chambers and Market Place shopping mall. Enter through Bourke Street Raymond Terrace.

Recommended for visitors from Raymond Terrace and the north. A free shuttle service will operate to and from the Open Day commencing at 8.30am. The last bus leaves at 2.30pm.

Services on routes 136 and 145 will run to the RAAF Base Williamtown. Passengers should use the bus stop on Nelson Bay Road just to the south of the Medowie Road/Nelson Bay Road roundabout to get to the event.

For public transport information, visit Newcastle Williamtown Air Show 2023 | transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Sunday 19 November – RAAF Base Williamtown Open Day (ticketed event)

The RAAF Base Williamtown gates will open at 9am for a ticketed, non-flying open day. The Sunday open day is ticketed for traffic, transport and parking considerations.

Motorists driving directly to the Open Day need to access the on base parking via Cabbage Tree Road or Nelson Bay Road. Parking cannot be accessed via Medowie Road from the north. Traffic marshals will assist with parking and a shuttle bus will operate between the car park and the Open Day display.

All access to the event is via assigned event ticket parking to either Raymond Terrace or RAAF Base park and ride shuttle buses.

Changed traffic conditions will be in place to safely facilitate the event. Motorists should expect delays and allow additional travel time around the RAAF Base Williamtown and Newcastle Airport and in particular Cabbage Tree Road, Tomago Road, Nelson Bay Road and Richardson Road.

Medowie Road will be closed between Nelson Bay Road and Richardson Road on the day.

arrangementElements.html:
From ​6am to ​5pm Sunday 19 November​ 2023

Medowie Road will be closed between Nelson Bay Road and Richardson Road.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

webLinks.linkText: Bridge to Bridge Water Ski Classic

properties.otherAdvice:
The Bridge 2 Bridge Water Ski Classic will be held from 7:30am until 3pm Saturday and Sunday. The Hawkesbury River will be exclusively used for the event.

On Sunday only, ferry services will be suspended at the following times while the race is underway:

  • Wisemans Ferry closure from 8:30am - 12pm
  • Webbs Creek Ferry closure from 8:30am - 12pm
  • Lower Portland Ferry closure from 8:30am - 12:30pm
  • Sackville Ferry closure from 8:30am - 1pm

Motorists travelling through the area should allow additional travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

roads.suburb: Sackville, Lower Portland, Webbs Creek and Wisemans Ferry

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 800 trucks and 900 motorbikes will form part of the annual i98 Illawarra convoy travelling from Appin and Bulli Tops to finish near Shellharbour Airport in Albion Park Rail. Motorbikes will leave from West Cliff Colliery, Appin from 8:15am, trucks will leave from Maddens Plains at 8.30am.

The convoy will travel via Appin Rd, Old Princes Hwy, M1 Princes Mwy, Masters Rd, Five Islands Rd, King St, Windang Rd, Shellharbour Rd, Lake Entrance Road, New Lake Entrance Rd and Princes Hwy. The convoy will finish at the Convoy shop, corner of Airport Rd and Princes Hwy, Albion Park Rail. Bikes will arrive from 9.15am and trucks from 10am.

Motorists may experience traffic delays along the convoy route. 

Speed reductions will be in effect at various times and locations between 4.30am and 3pm on sections of Appin Rd, M1 Princes Mwy and Princes Hwy.

The Old Princes Highway at Madden Plains will be closed between Helensburgh and Maddens Plains while trucks form up to participate in the convoy.

The right-hand turn from Old Mount Ousley Rd onto the M1 Princes Mwy/Mount Ousley Rd will be closed between 7am and 12pm. The convoy will travel in one lane along the route. 

Motorists are advised to take care as they share roads with the convoy vehicles and allow extra travel time in the area while changed traffic conditions are in place.

roads.mainStreet: via Appin Road, Old Princes Highway, M1 Motorway,

properties.otherAdvice:
Paramore at The Domain. Gates open at 5:30pm, event starts at 6:30pm and event finish around 11pm.

A sold out crowd of 25,000 fans are expected to attend the concert at the Phillip Precinct in The Domain.

Some roads around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed at Hospital Rd from 8pm.
  • Sections of Macquarie Rd, College St, Cathedral St, Hospital Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary’s Rd and St James Rd will be closed from 10pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads within and around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed at Hospital Rd from 8pm.

After the concert, the following roads will close from 10pm until 12.30am at the direction of NSW Police:

  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd

  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St

Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 9pm.

Road closures:

  • From 9am to 11:30pm: Darlinghurst Rd/Macleay St will be closed between Roslyn St and Greenknowe Ave. Sections of Orwell St and Hughes St will also close.
  • Motorists will be detoured via Greenknowe Ave and Macleay St and via Darlinghurst Rd and Roslyn St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and other local roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways are in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Harris St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures are in place until 11:30pm on:

  • Harris St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and John St
  • Miller St between Little Mount St and Harris St
  • Miller St between Saunders St and Little Mount Street (eastbound)
  • Union St between Harris St and Paternoster Row (eastbound)
  • Saunders St between exit of Saunders St and Miller St (eastbound)

Motorists will be detoured via Pyrmont St and John St.

Special event clearways are in effect until 11:30pm on sections of Harris St and Miller St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Forbes St will be closed between Terry St and Maybe St.

Maybe St will be closed between Forbes St and Caveat St.

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Grenfell Remembrance Day Commemorative Service will be held on Saturday 11 November 2023 at the Grenfell Memorial Park located on the corner of Mid Western Highway (Camp Street) and Weddin Street.
properties.diversions: Traffic will be detoured via East Street, Young Street and Wood Street

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ladies Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12:20pm, last race from 6:10pm and concert from 6:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5:30pm, full time around 7:25pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.
